intro: Bouchea notabilis, commonly known as the showy bouchea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its vibrant yellow to orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bouchea notabilis is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
